sect1.title: Modules and Tools
sect1.para: Modules are responsible for most of the Gwyddion features. They mostly include data processing functions as leveling, rotations, integral transforms, etc. See Data process menu for list of available modules.

Tools are a special kind of modules that work directly on data windows. They are used for interactive selection of areas, lines or other types of objects on the data and processing them. Tools can be launched only from tools button rows located in the main window. Gwyddion includes these tools:

listitem.para: Reads values at the position of mouse click.

Measures distances – similarly to Read value it tool enables user to measure horizontal, vertical and Euclidean distance and angle between points in the data field. In addition it displays the difference of data values between points.

Fits horizontal or vertical profiles by polynomial – very frequently used tool for basic processing of raw SPM data. Profiles taken in the fast scanning axis (usually x-axis) can be mutually shifted by some amount or having slightly different slope. Polynomial Profile Fit tool can fix this discrepancy.
Cuts part of the data, possibly putting the result to new window.
Basic filters – mean, median, conservative denoise, minimum, maximum and similar simple filters to reduce noise in the data.
Levels data by plane obtained by clicking on three points within data window. The three values can be averaged over a small area around the selected point.

Computes basic statistical quantities (RMS, Ra, minimum, maximum, projected and surface area, etc.) from a selection of full data field. It can also calculate them only the masked area, or even combine these two types of selection of area of interest.
Computes basic statistical functions (distribution of heights or slopes, autocorrelation function, power spectrum density function, etc.) from a selection of full data field.
Extracts profiles of the data field and puts them to separate graphs. These graphs can be further processed with commands from the Graph menu.
Removes continuous parts of the mask by clicking on mask point and/or interpolates (removes) data under a continuous part of mask.
Manually removes spots. Select a point on a data window, mark an area to interpolate on the zoomed view and remove the defect using chosen interpolation method.
Stretches color range or changes false color mapping type. It enables the user to change the false color representation range (by default from data minimum to data maximum).
Manual editing of masks: creation, exclusion, intersection, inversion, growing and shrinking, …
Somewhat complementary to 1D statistical functions, this tool plots characteristics such as mean, median or surface length for each row (column).
Row leveling tool equalizing the height along a set of arbitrary straight lines.

sect1.para: Tool dialogs can be closed (or more precisely hidden, as the current tool is still active even if its dialog is not visible), beside activating the Hide button, by pressing Esc or clicking the tool's button in the toolbox again.
